item.title: Data Entry Easy Job!!! - Upwork
item.description:
NOTE:: Top performing freelancers will receive more work!!! I have several thousand companies to lookup.

I need freelancers to help me identify the names -AND- emails of people that work at companies on a list that I will provide. I need you to find -ALL- of the people that match the following roles for -EACH- company on the list:

500 CEOs of companies in the US with 10-100 employees
250 CTOs of companies in LA that employ Ruby on Rails Engineers
250 CEOs of companies in LA with < 10 employees
Next week might look like:
500 CTOs of companies in SF that employ Ruby on Rails Engineers
500 CEOs of companies in AUSTIN with < 10 employees



NOTE!! Some companies will have more than one person working in the roles above. I only want -ONE- person per company, per job title. YOU WILL NOT BE PAID FOR MORE THAN ONE PERSON WORKING AT A COMPANY WITH THE SAME JOB TITLE.

To complete the job, provide me a CSV of 500 people with the following columns: company name, job title, full name, working email address.


Posted On: February 23, 2017 10:02 UTC
Category: Data Science & Analytics > Data Mining & Management
Skills: Data Analytics, Data Entry, Data Mining, Data Scraping, Internet Research, Lead Generation, Microsoft Excel, Research, Spreadsheets, Web Crawler, Web Scraping
Country: United States
click to apply

item.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer - Upwork
item.description:
Alliance 21 is a specialised logistics company offering a full suite of logistics solutions for our customers. We are looking for a software engineer to push the boundaries of logistics through technology, and to help the company in its digital transformation.

We are building a freight management system. Our technology stack is primarily Ruby on Rails, and we use Postgres, Heroku, complemented with Amazon Services. We make great use of Bootstrap, jQuery, and where we have complex front-end requirements, we use React JS.

We are looking for software engineers that share our values of:
- Writing clean, maintainable and efficient code
- Designing robust, scalable and secure features.
- Drive continuous adoption and integration of new and cutting edge technologies into design.
- Design and implement new features for the company web platforms.
- Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle.
- Follow best practices (test-driven development - RSpec, continuous integration, SCRUM, refactoring, code standards).
- Fixing and cleaning of bugs, and performing updates and upgrades to the infrastructure.


Posted On: February 23, 2017 10:02 UTC
Category: Web, Mobile & Software Dev > Web Development
Skills: CoffeeScript, React.js, RSpec, Ruby on Rails, Sass
Country: Singapore
click to apply

item.title: Improve young, existing Ruby on Rails 5 app. Knowledge of Google Maps API, Bootstrap, TDD/BDD, and hopefully ElasticSearch - Upwork
item.description:
We are looking for someone to make additions to a small app that is in Rails 5. It is using Bootstrap 4 (alpha).

The app is a prototype from within our company. It will require signing on/off, receiving messages, uploading images, finding things near them via Google Maps API (especially autocomplete), and searching for other users using search bar.

We are experienced at project management, use git and GitLab, and all the tools to help make your job as easy and clear as possible. Clear and timely communication is key for a successful partnership.

Much code is already finished. We need your help to:

>> Make the site responsive for mobile
>> Add Google Maps location for Users, so Users can find things near them
>> Add ElasticSearch, so that Users can search other Users' profiles
  We also wish to add "advanced search", so that users can enter queries such as "PHP -javascript projects" to find all PHP projects not requiring Javascript.
>> We plan to use Heroku to deploy
>> We plan to use Postgres

You will need to use TDD (or perhaps BDD, or similar) to ensure good, working, and clean code.

Designs and specifications are usually sent via Google Docs.


Posted On: February 23, 2017 10:02 UTC
Category: Web, Mobile & Software Dev > Web Development
Skills: CSS, CSS3, Google Maps API, HTML, HTML5, JavaScript, jQuery, Ruby on Rails, Web Design
Country: United States
click to apply

item.description:
We're looking for mid-level/senior Ruby on Rails developer with a lot of experience in javascript for an ongoing project.

Responsibilities
- Develop new features along with the improvement of existing ones
- Collaborate with the team to ensure all requirements are met and deliver high quality software
- Willing to help junior developers in the project

- Other tasks may be assigned as deemed necessary

Qualifications
- Advanced knowledge in javascript
- Experienced in Rails API
- Experienced in Rails 4.0
- Experienced interacting with APIs
- Can work well in a team

We expect you to be
- Available during PST working hours 9 AM – 5 PM
- Have quick response time
- Be proactively involved in development and communication
- Make suggestions to improve the system in terms of code quality and standard
- Interested in long term working relationship

item.title: Responsive, Single Page Web Application - Upwork
item.description:
Hi there,
We're looking to find a programmer(s) or team, that can help create this application with us. Please only bid if you're capable of creating a product like this, and responsible enough to manage yourself/team, do good work, follow design specs and functionality requirements, and just generally be pleasant and reliable.

Job description:
Responsive Web Application that allows locale storage with HTML 5, sharing via short URL, upgrade options that include additional URLs and reporting features on assets.

Web development project type:
New product

Client side or server side development:
Both

Specific programming languages desired:
We appreciate your thoughts and experiences, but here are the basics. If you have a better idea, then please feel free to share it.

PHP, HTML, CSS, Javascript, Python, Perl, Ruby on Rails:

Journey Tree:
1.0 A - Maker, Upload image (YouTube link, png, etc.) and sends for review to the Approver
2.0 B - Approver - Comments on Asset and sends to a team for review
3.0 C - Reviewer - Votes on comments, Maker is notified

User B can leave a note, attach an asset to the note (img/pdf/doc/ppt/etc), commit their note to finished and then User A receives an email notifications of User B's assets and note.

The Link is set to expire.
User A can set an expiration time for each asset;  12hrs, 24hrs, x, x, etc., after upload. After the expiration time, the assets are deleted and removed from our servers. There are a few other paid features, but nothing complicated or unfamiliar to a seasoned team.

Transactions:
The paid option requires user authentication, but remains anonymous on the front end. Paid option will be explained to the winner more clearly. We will most likely be using:
https://www.wepay.com/

Hosting/Staging:
We'll provide you with a staging area on our host Dreamhost acount. The application will be developed and reviewed on Dreamhost. We're happy to work with AWS, but you must also run a git repo, providing dumps for each milestone/track completion.

Emails:
If you can create a secure email server, then great—if not, we'll be using
https://www.mandrill.com/ or mailchimp

Additional comments:
We appreciate your time, talent, and patience. Our budget is fixed. The design of the UI is completely code-driven, with minimal image assets. The framework will be responsive, as will the emails between User A and User B.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A feature and functionality list will be sent to candidates once we've selected a few to speak with.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We will also provide detailed Wireframes, Functional specs, and Design comps. We will be as thorough as possible, in order to not waste your time. But as usual, there are always little details that can missed.

Timeline:
Phase one, outlined above, will be 1-7 wk process. It depends on your skills and how quickly you'd like to work and finish the job. We respect your time and will work at your pace, provided we can meet our overall timeline. Please feel free to ask questions.

Thanks for your time and consideration.

Budget: $2,550
Posted On: February 23, 2017 10:02 UTC
Category: Web, Mobile & Software Dev > Web & Mobile Design
Skills: Adobe Photoshop, Agile Software Development, Amazon Web Services, CSS3, Email Handling, Email Technical Support, HTML5, jQuery, MySQL Administration, Payment Gateway Integration, Payment Processing, PHP, PSD to HTML, Responsive Web Design, Website Analytics, Website Development
Country: United States
click to apply

item.title: Developer for Technical Advisory - Upwork
item.description:
We need a developer with experience as CTO to help us define technology stack for different projects we are working on with designers now.

It would be a part time position. Basically tasks would consist in:

- Team building, interviewing, selecting best providers
- Technical advisory and strategy
- Technology selection
- Daily team check-in (scrum) and task review/assignment
- Weekly code reviews
- Infrastructure management and support

Ideally we are looking for a developer with experience in project management and technologies like:

Wordpress
PHP
Node.js
Phyton
Ruby

We would share with you brief and wireframes of the projects and we would need a clear roadmap for development and technologies to use.

We could also work on regular basis on project management for development.

p.s Please offer monthly rate part-time agreement (20 hrs).

Thansk in advance

Budget: $1,000
Posted On: February 23, 2017 10:02 UTC
Category: Web, Mobile & Software Dev > Web Development
Skills: Agile Project Management, CSS, Django, Node.js, PHP, Project Planning, Ruby on Rails, Scrum, WordPress, Wordpress Multisite

item.title: Need help finalizing a website built with Ember - Upwork
item.description:
I need help to finalize a website is nearly finished. It was built during a hackathon, but requires a few changes, a few additions, and a few bugs to be fixed.

The app is written entirely in Ember, there's no database or persistence layer. The majority of the game's content is contained within a single enormous overloaded component (question_space.js)

If you accept this job, the previous developer will work with you to explain the code so far.

Please give me a shout!

Richie


Posted On: February 23, 2017 10:02 UTC
Category: Web, Mobile & Software Dev > Web Development
Skills: Ember.js, Graphic Design, JavaScript, PostgreSQL Programming, Ruby, Ruby on Rails
Country: Canada
click to apply

item.title: Iphone/apple laptop styling issues - Upwork
item.description:
I have a ruby app and I am having a hard time getting the styles to be correct on iphones and apple lap tops.

Specifically I am using this block:

@media only screen and (min--moz-device-pixel-ratio: 2),
only screen and (-o-min-device-pixel-ratio: 2/1),
only screen and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio : 1.5),
only screen and (min-device-pixel-ratio : 1.5),
only screen and (min-device-pixel-ratio: 2) {​

And this line here: min-device-pixel-ratio : 1.5 makes it look correct on an iphone but makes it look like the iphone version on a 13" apple lap top.  I've tried a lot of things including basic @media only screen and (max-width: 649px) {​ queries too and that didn't work either.

I have attached the entire style sheet, please let me know


Posted On: February 23, 2017 10:02 UTC
Category: Web, Mobile & Software Dev > Web Development
Country: United States
click to apply

item.title: Sketchup work using older versions 7 or 8 - Upwork
item.description:
Need help working with an older version of Sketchup - either 7 or 8 and we will use a plug in called WebExporter or swivel to generate different cuts of a building in jpeg.
I need to run the program on a server, have it open without the start box, import a dxf drawing (we generate from an engineering program) - we have the dxf imports for older versions, add selected color and texture to grouped layers, modify the WebExporter plugin (presently it takes pictures around the outside) to also do a walk though, execute the webexporter to generate the dynamic output.  There will be work in Ruby and I need the panorama background made where the dxf building would be imported.

You can see the program work by designing a building in our design system at http://rapidset.designbuildsystems.com/  at the end when you get a quote you will see the imported 3D of the building designed.  The task would be to make the 3D dynamic

Budget: $500
Posted On: February 23, 2017 10:02 UTC
Category: Web, Mobile & Software Dev > Scripts & Utilities
Country: United States
click to apply

item.title: Mature Rails app with complex domain model - Upwork
item.description:
Looking for a reasonably priced experienced remote team with good
communication skills, 2-6 people, full time, mid to advanced.  Remote
team would likely be managed by a single point of contact and
participate via Pivotal and Slack, eventually integrated more fully
into sprint process.

Would like to start with a small investment to explore the
relationship If the price is reasonable and the team is good, we would want to increase velocity by scaling up, so ideally would like to find a company that has resources to do this.

Term: 2 months to start, ongoing thereafter

Tech stack:

- Rails 4
- Minitest unit tests, Functionals, Jasmine tests, and Capybara tests
with good coverage (takes 10-15 minutes to run on CircleCI)
- Internationalized using Rails 18n
- Combination of front end frameworks.  Mixture of front end
frameworks: Jquery, Backbone, React.
- New features developed primarily in React.
- API surface in addition to HTML used by some customers
- HAML templates, Foundation CSS
- Pusher/Websockets for real-time in app updates in some parts of the app
- Thinking sphinx search

Current team:

- 2 week sprints, daily standup, estimation meeting,
sprint planning meeting, periodic deployments
- Product backlog and infrastructure backlogs, managed using pivotal tracker

Projects/scope of work:

- Bug fixes in specialized domain-specific app
- New feature development:
- Building out task management system
- Upgrade to Rails 4, possibly 5 eventually
- Continue to build out API
- Configurable dashboard feature
- Import/export some domain models, possibly using YAML
- Improved search, such as Elasticsearch or other hosted search
- Refactor existing features to use modern technology

along with some new features which are hard to describe without domain
specific knowledge

Public product URL available upon request


Posted On: February 23, 2017 10:02 UTC
Category: Web, Mobile & Software Dev > Web Development
Skills: Backbone.js, Git, HAML, jQuery, React.js, Ruby, Ruby on Rails
Country: United States
click to apply

into sprint process.

Would like to start with a small investment to explore the
relationship If the price is reasonable and the team is good, we would want to increase velocity by scaling up, so ideally would like to find a company that has resources to do this.

Term: 2 months to start, ongoing thereafter

Tech stack:

- Rails 4
- Minitest unit tests, Functionals, Jasmine tests, and Capybara tests
with good coverage (takes 10-15 minutes to run on CircleCI)
- Internationalized using Rails 18n
- Combination of front end frameworks.  Mixture of front end
frameworks: Jquery, Backbone, React.
- New features developed primarily in React.
- API surface in addition to HTML used by some customers
- HAML templates, Foundation CSS
- Pusher/Websockets for real-time in app updates in some parts of the app
- Thinking sphinx search

Current team:

- 2 week sprints, daily standup, estimation meeting,
sprint planning meeting, periodic deployments
- Product backlog and infrastructure backlogs, managed using pivotal tracker

Projects/scope of work:

- Bug fixes in specialized domain-specific app
- New feature development:
- Building out task management system
- Upgrade to Rails 4, possibly 5 eventually
- Continue to build out API
- Configurable dashboard feature
- Import/export some domain models, possibly using YAML
- Improved search, such as Elasticsearch or other hosted search
- Refactor existing features to use modern technology

along with some new features which are hard to describe without domain
specific knowledge

Public product URL available upon request


Posted On: February 23, 2017 10:02 UTC
Category: Web, Mobile & Software Dev > Web Development
Skills: Backbone.js, Git, HAML, jQuery, React.js, Ruby, Ruby on Rails
Country: United States
click to apply

item.title: Convert sketch files to HTML - Upwork
item.description:
Sketch Mockups to HTML Job

Links to Sketch mock-ups and gitlab repo will be shared with you upon project start.

Specification

Convert 4 sketch files to HTML
1. Use Zurb Foundation Framework v6:
- Grid
- Button elements etc.
- Do not use what is not in Zurb (we don’t want to support custom solutions later)
2. Use SCSS preprocessor and zurb variables override (_settings.scss)
3. Custom styles to fo (application.css)
4. Page specific styles go to (landings.scss)
5. Rails project will be shared with you
6. Integrate it into rails project into two controllers
- Landing
- Dashboard
7. Styles should be in

List of pages by Sketch file name, ordered by priority:
- Web V.2 (Landing)
- Desktop HD Styleguide
- Profile Dashboard
- Delete All (text overlay)
- Message Form (Modal Dialog)

Timeline

24 Feb 2017 - Web V.2 (Landing), responding as /
25 Feb 2017 - Profile Dashboard
25 Feb 2017 - Delete All (text overlay)
26 Feb 2017 - Message Form (Modal Dialog)


Budget: $200

Skills: CSS, HTML, PSD to HTML, Ruby on Rails, Zurb Foundation

item.title: Sr. Ruby on Rails Developer - Upwork
item.description:
I am seeking a talented Senior Ruby on Rails developer  to make small, infrequent changes and fixes to our company Website.  The website is a completed eCommerce and social media site that has very little active development occurring on it at this time.

The website runs on a PostgreSQL database.  One important skill is the developer needs a very good understanding of SQL (including doing inner and outer table joins.)

This job will be ongoing and part time, depending upon our need.  It will probably consume 0-10 hours per week and have great flexibility.

Category: Web, Mobile & Software Dev > Ecommerce Development
Skills: PostgreSQL Programming, Ruby, Ruby on Rails
Country: United States

item.title: Ruby on Rails with Javascript experience - Upwork
item.description:
We are using discourse as a base for our forum and mixpanel for our visitor tracking, and we're looking for a developer that is able to read, understand our installation and mixpanel APIs to make sure that we're able to track traffic by username on mixpanel.

We're looking for a Web Developer.

Your responsibilities:

- Review business requirements
- Perform a technical analysis of requirements
- Produce a solid, detailed technical design
- Write clean, modular, robust code to implement the desired requirements
- Contribute ideas for making the application better and easier to use

Your qualifications:

- A work style that is extremely detail oriented
- A complete Upwork profile
- References or an established reputation on Upwork preferred

item.title: Need to build some additional functionality in our Shopify store. - Upwork
item.description:
We sell online courses and we want to offer a self-service function for our clients to print their certificates.

We want clients to be able to enter their name, email address, and 2 additional fields (to determine the size and type of certificate required).

The visitor should then be able to print their certificate.

We need this to work seamlessly from within our Shopify store (Supply Theme).

Can you do this for us?

item.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer Needed - Upwork
item.description:
Form of employment: full-time

Conditions:
• You will work together with an international team of highly qualified and motivated professionals;
• You will work in a team of 4 Senior Ruby developers and QA;
• Competitive official salary;
• Possibility of professional self-realization;
• A friendly and cohesive team;
• 26 days of paid vacation;
• 100% paid sick;
• Fun activities and corporate gifts to important dates in life;
• Mac-book Pro to work on the project.
• We are sure that you will feel comfortable in our cozy office in the center of Minsk (with table football, a coffee machine, fruit, etc.);

Requirements for a candidate:
• Intermediate speaking English;
• Ruby (Ruby on Rails) (> 2 years);
•Javascript
• HTML;
• CSS.

I will provide the detailed documentation of project.
Please write the word "SR Ruby Engineer" in your applies.

Thanks.
